title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the short title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Art Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges. The American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Art Development Act includes tribally controlled community colleges. The term "tribally controlled community colleges" is defined in section 2(a)(4) of the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978. "Tribally controlled community colleges are defined by the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978 as post-secondary vocational institutions." "Tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions are defined by the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978." SEC. 3. Land grant status for tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions, including the Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College, shall be considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. Indian Junior College shall be considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The applicability of related provisions of any Act of Congress relating to the operation or provision of assistance to. The applicability of provisions of any Act of Congress relating to assistance to land-grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands shall apply to the land-grant colleges and institutions. The provisions of any Act of Congress relating to assistance to land-grant colleges in various regions shall apply to the colleges and institutions in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of appropriations. Authorization of appropriations for land-grant colleges and institutions described in the previous subsection, in lieu of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, relating to donations of public land or land script for the endowment and maintenance of colleges. Authorization of appropriations for land-grant colleges and institutions to benefit agriculture and the mechanic arts, with an authorized appropriation of $10,000,000 to such tribal colleges and institutions. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this. Authorized appropriation of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions to benefit agriculture and the mechanic arts. Amounts granted to these colleges and institutions shall be held and considered as proceeds from the sale of land or land script. The Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as such. The term "1994 Institutions" in the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 refers to specific colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, and Nebraska Indian Community College. Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College. Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College. (22) Navajo Community College, (23) United Tribes Technical College, (24) Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, (25) Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, (26) Crownpoint Institute of Technology, (27) Haskell Indian Junior College, (28) Leech Lake Tribal College, (29) College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Any provision of Congress relating to land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions. The provision of any Act of Congress relating to assistance for land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions in the same manner. Exceptions apply to agricultural research funding for colleges eligible under the Act of August 30, 1890. The provision of any Act of Congress relating to assistance for land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions in the same manner. Exceptions apply to agricultural research funding for colleges eligible under specific Acts. Authorization of appropriations is addressed for 1994 Institutions. Authorization of appropriations is addressed for 1994 Institutions, with $23,000,000 authorized to be appropriated. Authorized $23,000,000 to be appropriated for 1994 Institutions under the Act relating to donations of public land for colleges benefiting agriculture and mechanic arts. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include $50,000 funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include $50,000 funding for 1994 Institutions. Amendments include adding "1994 Institutions" to various sections and specifying payment to the treasurer of such institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include $50,000 funding for 1994 Institutions, with amendments specifying payment to the treasurer of such institutions for each fiscal year. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes $5,000,000 for 1994 Institutions annually for specified purposes. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions for specific purposes, distributed through a competitive applications process. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions through a competitive applications process developed by the Secretary. There is no matching requirement for funds. The Act of May 8, 1914 authorizes $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions through a competitive applications process developed by the Secretary. There shall be no matching requirement for funds made available pursuant to subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and facilities for agricultural research from 1995 to 1999. The Act aims to help 1994 Institutions with constructing, acquiring, and remodeling facilities for agricultural research through matching grants awarded competitively. For fiscal years 1995 through 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized for grants to 1994 Institutions for specific purposes related to agricultural research facilities. Amend the title to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
